DOC.brief_title: Nitrous Oxide Vasodilation Healthy Adult Volunteers
DOC.criteria: Healthy adult volunteer . 19 year old ( inclusive ) English speaking . ASA class III great ; History , suspect , difﬁcult airway base physical exam , facial dysmorphism syndrome Any condition air may trap body cavity . These include , limited : Pneumothorax chest injury , concurrent acute asthma exacerbation , middle ear occlusion , intestinal obstruction , ileus , abdominal distension , sinusitis maxillofacial injury potential trap gas , recent intraocular surgery penetrate globe injury , air embolus , severe bullous emphysema ( consider patient cystic ﬁbrosis ) , history craniotomy previous three week Pregnancy ( 1st 2nd trimester ) Increased intracranial pressure , impaired level consciousness , head injury Known Vitamin B12 deﬁciency Known MTHFR Deﬁciency ( Inborn error metabolism ) History bleomycin administration ( note oxygen component N2O administration interacts bleomycin cause pulmonary toxicity ) Intoxication alcohol drug Any condition patient may catecholaminedepleted ( e.g . septic shock ) Recent history alter mental status Pulmonary hypertension Congestive heart failure .
